place.name: STOCKTON
place.gazetteerText: STOCKTON, a parish in Loddon district, Norfolk; 3½ miles NW of Beccles r. station. Post town, Bungay. Acres, 1,051. Real property, £1,714. Pop., 129. Houses, 27. The manor is held, under the Crown, by J. Kerrick, Esq. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Norwich. Value, £280. Patron, Mrs. Carlos. The church is good. There is a town estate £65. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
